title: Eritrean–Ethiopian War
summary: The Eritrean–Ethiopian War was a conflict that took place between Ethiopia and Eritrea from May 1998 to June 2000, with the final peace only agreed to in 2018, twenty years after the initial confrontation.[10] Eritrea and Ethiopia both spent considerable amount of their revenue and wealth on the armament ahead of the war and suffered reportedly 100,000 casualties combined as a direct consequence thereof, excluding indeterminate number of refugees.[34][35][36][37] The conflict ultimately led to minor border changes through final binding border delimitation overseen by the Permanent Court of Arbitration.
